sen.j: 阪急電鉄株式会社（はんきゅうでんてつ、英語 Hankyu Corporation）は、大阪梅田駅と神戸市・宝塚市・京都市を結ぶ大手私鉄。
sen.e: Hankyu Corporation (Hankyu Dentetsu) is a major private railway company operating the railways that connect Osaka Umeda Station with Kobe City, Takarazuka City, and Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1907年に設立された箕面有馬電気軌道が、1910年3月10日に現在の宝塚本線・箕面線にあたる梅田駅～宝塚駅、石橋駅 (大阪府)～箕面駅を開業したのが始まり。
sen.e: The initiation of the company dated back to March 10, 1910, when Minoo-Arima Electric Tramline (Minoo-Arima denki kido) began operating the section between Umeda Station and Takarazuka Station as well as the section between Ishibashi Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Minoo Station, which respectively corresponds to the current Takarazuka Line and the Minoo Line.

sen.j: 創業者の小林一三は経営安定のため沿線開発に力を入れ、住宅地分譲、宝塚新温泉、宝塚唱歌隊（後の少女歌劇団、現在の宝塚歌劇団）などの事業を多角的に展開した。
sen.e: The founder, Ichizo KOBAYASHI made efforts in developing the areas along the railway line, in order to stabilize the management and introduced multiple businesses, such as, selling land in lot, developing Takarazuka New Hot Spring, and creating the Takarazuka Shokatai (Takarazuka Chorus Group), which is the later Shojo Kageki-dan (girls' operetta company), and the actual Takarazuka Revue Company.

sen.j: なお、「電鉄」という語は、「電気鉄道」という語を商号に使用することに、鉄道省があくまで軌道法準拠の「電気軌道」である事を根拠として難色を示したことから、対策として小林一三が考え出した語で、以後軌道法監督下の各社が高速電気鉄道への脱皮を図る際に有効活用されることとなった。
sen.e: By the way, the word "Dentetsu" is a coined term made by Ichizo KOBAYASHI, because the then Japanese Government of Railways (JGR) opposed to the use of the word "Denki Tetsudo" (electric railway)," as a corporate name, based on the argument that this name was considered identical with "electric tramways," the term regulated by the Tramways Act, therefore, the word, "Dentetsu" was conveniently adopted, afterwards, by various companies regulated by the Tramways Act, when they intended to morph into rapid electric railways.

Incidentally, the word "Dentetsu" is a coined term by Ichizo Kobayashi, because the then Japanese Government of Railways (JGR) was opposed to the use of the term "Denki Tetsudo" (electric railway)" as a corporate name, based on the argument that this name was considered identical with "electric tramways," the term regulated by the Tramways Act; thereafter, the word "Dentetsu" was conveniently adopted by various companies regulated by the Tramways Act when they intended to morph into rapid electric railways.

sen.j: 1943年、戦時企業統合政策（陸上交通事業調整法）により京阪電気鉄道を合併、京阪神急行電鉄となる（この経緯については阪神急行電鉄京阪電気鉄道の統合と分離も参照）。
sen.e: In 1943, under the wartime enterprise integration policy -"Rikujokotsu Jigyo Chosei-ho" (land traffic business adjustment act)- the company incorporated Keihan Electric Railway and became Keihanshin Electric Express Railway (for details of the merger, please refer to "Unification of Hanshin Electric Express Railway and Keihan Electric Railway").

sen.j: なお、このとき「阪急」と「京阪」の略称は公式には使用されなくなり「京阪神（急行）」とされたが、世間には定着せず、大阪市電の電停名でも「阪急阪神前」（梅田）・「京阪前」（天満橋）・「京阪神急行前」（天六）などと、混合して用いられていたといわれている。
sen.e: since then, the abbreviated name "Hankyu" and "Keihan" were officially disused and "Keihanshin (Express)" was introduced as a new abbreviation, the new name had not been fixed among the people and these names were used in a confused manner, such as "Hankyu-Hanshin-mae" (Umeda) for an Osaka city tram station (Umeda), "Keihan-mae"(Tenmabashi), or "Keihanshin-kyuko-mae" (Tenroku).

Subsequently, the abbreviated name "Hankyu" and "Keihan" were officially abandoned and "Keihanshin (Express)" was introduced as a new abbreviation; however, the new name had not been fixed among the people and these names were used in a confused manner, such as "Hankyu-Hanshin-mae" (Umeda) for an Osaka city tram station (Umeda), "Keihan-mae"(Tenmabashi) or "Keihanshin-kyuko-mae" (Tenroku).

sen.j: 戦後の1949年に京阪線・交野線・宇治線・京津線・石山坂本線が京阪電気鉄道として再分離。
sen.e: After the war, in 1949, the Keihan Line, Katano Line, Uji Line, Keishin Line, and Ishiyama-Sakamoto Line were separated to form Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 追い討ちをかけるように、1995年1月17日の阪神・淡路大震災では、神戸本線・伊丹線・今津（北）線などが甚大な被害を受けたが、同年6月12日にほぼ全線が復旧、1998年には伊丹駅 (阪急)も再建された。
sen.e: In addition, the Kobe Line, Itami Line, and the Imazu Line, among others, were seriously damaged by the great Hanshin Awaji Earthquake occurred on January 17, 1995, but almost all lines were restored by June 12 of the same year and Itami Station (Hankyu) was reconstructed in 1998.

sen.j: 震災以降も、長引く消費不況や西日本旅客鉄道などとの激しい競合、少子化などの影響により輸送人員は減少。
sen.e: However, by the influence of the prolonged consumers' recession, intensified competition with West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and the declining birthrate, the number of passengers has decreased.

sen.j: 不動産・ホテル事業の再編や、宝塚新温泉以来90年以上の歴史を持つ遊園地「宝塚ファミリーランド」の閉園、ポートアイランドにあった「神戸ポートピアランド」からの事業撤退（その後暫くは神戸市の手で運営を継続ののち、2006年閉園）など、グループ事業の再編が進められる。
sen.e: The group's businesses are now undergoing the reorganization, such as, the restructuring of real estate and hotel management, the closing of an amusement park "Takarazuka Family Land," which has more than 90 years' history since the opening Takarazuka New Hot Spring, and the withdrawal from the management of "Kobe Portopia Land" located in the Port Island (it was run by Kobe City for a while afterwards, but definitively closed in 2006).

sen.j: その集大成として、2005年4月1日に、旧・阪急電鉄から鉄道、不動産、レジャー、流通の4事業を分割承継する新・阪急電鉄（阪急電鉄分割準備（株）から商号変更）と、ホテル経営を統括する阪急ホテルマネジメント、旅行業の阪急交通社の直営事業会社2社の合わせて3社に再編し、旧・阪急電鉄は持株会社阪急ホールディングス（現・阪急阪神ホールディングス）に移行した。
sen.e: And to finalize the restructure, on April 1, 2005, the company was reorganized into 3 companies: i) New Hankyu Corporation (the corporate name was changed from Hankyu Dentetsu Bunkatsu Junbi KK (Hankyu corporation division preparation company)), which partially succeeded 4 businesses -railway, real estate, leisure, and commodity distribution- from the former Hankyu Corporation, ii) Hankyu Hotel Management, which controls the hotel business, and iii) Hankyu Travel International Co., Ltd., for tour business, amalgamating two direct subsidiaries: and the former Hankyu Railway was transferred to the holding company, Hankyu Holdings (current Hankyu Hanshin Holdings, Inc.).
sen.cmt: 阪急電鉄分割準備（株） →定訳不明：Hankyu Dentesu Bunkatsu Junbi KK (Hankyu corporation division preparation)としました。阪急ホテルマネジメント→Hanshin Hotel Management (http://hankyu-hotal.com/group/management.html) 阪急交通社→Hankyu Travel International (http://hankyu-travel.com/company/outline/about.html) 阪急ホールディングス→Hankyu Holdings (http://holdings.hankyu-hanshin.co.jp/index.html) 阪急阪神ホールディングス→Hankyu Hanshin Holdings(http://holdings.hankyu-hanshin.co.jp/index.html)
sen.e: To finalize the restructuring, on April 1, 2005 the company was reorganized into three companies: i) New Hankyu Corporation (the corporate name was changed from Hankyu Dentetsu Bunkatsu Junbi KK (Hankyu Corporation Division Preparation Company)), which partially succeeded four businesses--railway, real estate, leisure and commodity distribution--from the former Hankyu Corporation, ii) Hankyu Hotel Management, which controls the hotel business, and iii) Hankyu Travel International Co., Ltd., for tour business, amalgamating two direct subsidiaries; moreover, the former Hankyu Railway was transferred to the company Hankyu Holdings (currently Hankyu Hanshin Holdings, Inc.).

To finalize the restructuring, on April 1, 2005 the company was reorganized into three companies: i) New Hankyu Corporation (the corporate name was changed from Hankyu Dentetsu Bunkatsu Junbi KK (Hankyu Corporation Division Preparation Company)), which partially succeeded four businesses--railway, real estate, leisure and commodity distribution--from the former Hankyu Corporation, ii) Hankyu Hotel Management, which controls the hotel business, and iii) Hankyu Travel International Co., Ltd., for tour business, amalgamating two direct subsidiaries; moreover, the former Hankyu Railway was transferred to the company Hankyu Holdings (currently Hankyu Hanshin Holdings, Inc.).

sen.j: 阪急の路線にはトンネルがほとんど存在しない。
sen.e: Hankyu lines have very few tunnels.
The Hankyu lines have very few tunnels.
The Hankyu lines have very few tunnels.

sen.j: 工期と費用がかさみ、明治～大正時代の土木技術では危険が大きかったため、意図的にトンネル工事を避けたためである。
sen.e: Because they were deliberately avoided, as the construction of tunnels was very costly and extremely dangerous with the civil engineering technology available in the Meiji and Taisho periods.

This was because they were deliberately avoided, since the construction of tunnels was very costly and extremely dangerous with the civil engineering technology available during the Meiji and Taisho periods.

This was because they were deliberately avoided, as the construction of tunnels was very costly, time consuming, and extremely dangerous with the civil engineering technology available during the Meiji and Taisho periods.

sen.j: 宝塚線はトンネルを必要とするルートを避けた結果、カーブの多い路線となった。
sen.e: The Takarazuka Line was constructed avoiding the routes that required tunneling, and as a result, it has many curves.
The Takarazuka Line was constructed by avoiding routes that would have required tunneling, and as a result it has many curves.
The Takarazuka Line was constructed by avoiding routes that would have required tunneling, and as a result it has many curves.

sen.j: 現在でもトンネルは第二種鉄道事業区間（神戸高速鉄道）を除くと全線で3か所しか存在せず、そのうち2か所は西院～河原町間と天六付近の地下線へ通じる入口で、出入口がある純粋なトンネルは千里線の千里トンネルただ一つである。
sen.e: Even nowadays, there are only three tunnels in all lines except for the section designated as a "second class railway business" (Kobe Rapid Transit Railway), and moreover, two of them serve as an entrance toward a underground lane, one between Saiin and Kawaramachi and the other, near Tenroku, therefore, Senri Tunnel on the Senri Line is the only tunnel that genuinely has the beginning and end.

Even nowadays there are only three tunnels in all lines except for the section designated as a "second-class railway business" (Kobe Rapid Transit Railway), and moreover, two of them serve as an entrance toward a underground lane, one between Saiin and Kawaramachi and the other, near Tenroku; therefore, Senri Tunnel on the Senri Line is the only tunnel that actually has a beginning and an end.

Even today there are only three tunnels in all lines except for the section designated as a second-class railway business (Kobe Rapid Transit Railway), and moreover, two of them serve as entrances toward underground lanes, one between Saiin and Kawaramachi and the other, near Tenroku; therefore, Senri Tunnel on the Senri Line is the only tunnel that in fact has a beginning and an end.
sen.cmt: toward a →toward an 括弧修正"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: なお、直通運転を行っている能勢電鉄には数多くのトンネルがある。
sen.e: However, Nose Railway that offers the direct operation has many tunnels.
However, Nose Railway, which offers direct operation, has many tunnels.
However, Nose Railway, which offers direct operation, has many tunnels.

sen.j: 阪神電気鉄道阪神西大阪線が近鉄難波駅まで開業する2009年以降は（開業後は阪神なんば線に改称）、関西では唯一大阪市中央区 (大阪市) に路線がない大手私鉄となる（但し京都線の車両自体は堺筋線を介して中央区に乗り入れているものもある）。
sen.e: From 2009, when the Hanshin Nishi-Osaka Line of Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd is extended to Kintetsu Namba Station (scheduled to be called Hanshin Namba Line after the inauguration), Hankyu Railway will be the only big private railway company in the Kansai District which has no line in the area of Chuo Ward, Osaka City (although, some of the trains on the Kyoto Line (Hankyu) go to Chuo Ward using the track of the Osaka City subway Sakaisuji Line).

From 2009, when the Hanshin Nishi-Osaka Line of Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd. is extended to Kintetsu Namba Station (scheduled to be called the Hanshin Namba Line after its inauguration), the Hankyu Railway will be the only large private railway company in the Kansai District that has no line in the area of Chuo Ward, Osaka City (although some of the trains on the Kyoto Line (Hankyu) go to Chuo Ward by using the track of the Osaka City subway Sakaisuji Line).

From 2009, when the Hanshin Nishi-Osaka Line of Hanshin Electric Railway Co., Ltd. is extended to Kintetsu Nanba Station (which is scheduled to be called the Hanshin Nanba Line after its inauguration), the Hankyu Railway will be the only large private railway company in the Kansai District that has no line in the area of Chuo Ward, Osaka City (although some of the trains on the Kyoto Line (Hankyu) go to Chuo Ward by using the track of the Osaka Municipal Subway's Sakaisuji Line).

sen.j: 箕面有馬電気軌道（箕有）、および、その後身の阪神急行電鉄（阪急）によって敷設された神戸線・宝塚線（神宝線）と、北大阪電気鉄道、および、その後身の新京阪鉄道によって敷設された京都線とでは、その成り立ちが異なるため、車両規格に違いがある。
sen.e: The rolling stock used on the Minoo-Arima Electric Tramline and on the Kobe Line/Takarazuka Line (Jinpo-Sen) that were constructed by its successor, Hanshin Electric Express Railway (Hankyu) and the rolling stock used on the Kita-Osaka Electric Railway and the Kyoto Line, which was constructed by its successor, Shinkeihan Railway, are different in specification because of the different backgrounds.
sen.cmt: 箕面有馬電気軌道（箕有）→Minoo-Arima Electric Tramline、阪神急行電鉄（阪急）→Hanshin Electric Express Railway (Hankyu) (http://www.jtr.net/jtr08/history.html)、新京阪鉄道→定訳不明:Shinkeihan Railway
sen.e: The rolling stock used on the Minoo-Arima Electric Tramline and on the Kobe Line/Takarazuka Line (Jinpo-Sen) that were constructed by its successor Hanshin Electric Express Railway (Hankyu), as well as the rolling stock used on the Kita-Osaka Electric Railway and the Kyoto Line, as constructed by its successor Shinkeihan Railway, differ in their specifications due to the different backgrounds.

The rolling stock used on the Mino-Arima Electric Tramline and on the Kobe Line/Takarazuka Line (Jinpo-Sen) that were constructed by its successor Hanshin Electric Express Railway (Hankyu), as well as the rolling stock used on the Kita-Osaka Electric Railway and the Kyoto Line, as constructed by its successor Shinkeihan Railway, differ in their specifications due to the different backgrounds.

sen.j: 車両の電装品も、神宝線は東芝製、京都線は新京阪時代の名残で東洋電機製造製と分けられている。
sen.e: As for electric components, trains for the Jinpo-Sen (Kobe/Takarazuka Lines) uses the products by Toshiba, while the trains on the Kyoto Line are still equipped with the products by Toyo Denki Seizo, as a vestige of the Shin-Keihan Railway time.
sen.cmt: 東洋電機製造→Toyo Denki Seizo (K.K.) (和英翻訳データブック：ジャパンタイムズ編）
sen.e: As for electric components, trains for the Jinpo-Sen (Kobe/Takarazuka Lines) use products by Toshiba, while the trains on the Kyoto Line are still equipped with products by Toyo Denki Seizo, as a vestige of the Shin-Keihan Railway era.

As for electric components, trains for the Jinpo-sen (Kobe/Takarazuka Lines) use products by Toshiba, while the trains on the Kyoto Line are still equipped with products by Toyo Denki Seizo, as a vestige of the Shinkeihan Railway era.

sen.j: 今でもこの慣習を守り続けている（ほかに、阪急において東芝製品は神宝線の電装品のほかに全駅の駅務機器や電車のエア・コンディショナー、エレベーター、業務用パーソナルコンピュータなど幅広い分野で使用されている）。
sen.e: This custom is still maintained (in addition to the electric components used on the Jinpo-Sen (Kobe/Takarazuka Lines), Toshiba products are used in various ares in Hankyu Railways, such as the office equipment of all stations, air conditioners installed in the cars, elevators, personal computers for business use).

sen.j: 戦後1948年の阪急550形電車以後、すべての阪急車両は系列のナニワ工機（後のアルナ車両）が建造していた（阪急では車両を新規製造することを「建造」と表現する）。
sen.e: Since Hankyu (Electric) Railway Series 550 was born in 1948, after the war, the Hankyu's rolling stock have been fabricated by Naniwa-Koki (later, Alna Sharyo (rolling stock) Co., Ltd.), an affiliate of the company (in Hankyu Railway, the word "build" is used to refer to the fabrication of a new series of rolling stock).
sen.cmt: 阪急550形→Hankyu (Electric) Railway Series (用語リスト#3747参照）、ナニワ工機（アルナ車両）→Naniwa-Koki (Alna Sharyo (rolling stock) Co. Ltd.) (http://ww.holdings.hankyu-hanshin.co.jp/ir/zaimu/ar2004e.pdf参照)。 「建造」と表現する→the word "build "is used.
sen.e: Because Hankyu (Electric) Railway Series 550 was born in 1948, after the war, the Hankyu's rolling stock have been fabricated by Naniwa-Koki (later, Alna Sharyo (rolling stock) Co., Ltd.), an affiliate of the company (in Hankyu Railway, the word "build" is used to refer to the fabrication of a new series of rolling stock).

sen.j: なお、阪急の経営事情は依然として厳しいことから、新車投入と平行して、1960年代後半～1980年代前半に製造された車両をアルナ車両やグローバルテックにて更新工事を施工し、延命使用する措置を取っている（うち1970年代前半までの車両に関しては再度の更新工事施工となる）。
sen.e: As Hankyu Corporation still suffers a severe financial health, in pararel with the the investment in new trains, the cars fabricated from the late 1960s to the early 1980s are renovated at Alna Sharyo Co., Ltd.. and Hitachi, Ltd., in order to prolong their life for practical use, (among them, those fabricated in the early 1970s or before undergo the second renovation).

Because Hankyu Corporation still suffers from severe financial health, in parallel with the investment in new trains, the cars fabricated from the late 1960s to the early 1980s are renovated at Alna Sharyo Co., Ltd. and Globaltec Ltd., in order to prolong their life for practical use (among them, those fabricated in the early 1970s or before have undergone a second renovation).

sen.j: 阪急ホールディングス（現・阪急阪神ホールディングス）として持株会社となる前の旧・阪急電鉄は1936年から1988年までプロ野球球団、阪急ブレーブス（後にオリックス・ブルーウェーブ、現在はオリックス・バファローズ）を、西宮球場（後の阪急西宮スタジアム、2002年に閉鎖）をプロ野球地域保護権として所有していた。
sen.e: Old Hankyu Company, which later became Hankyu Holdings (current Hankyu Hanshin Holdings), was the parent company of a pro baseball team, Hankyu Braves (later Orix Blue Wave and current Orix Buffaloes), and owed the Nishinomiya Kyujo (later Hankyu Nishinomiya Stadium which was closed in 2002) under the right of pro baseball area protection.
sen.cmt: 阪急ブレーブス、オリックス・ブルーウェーブ、、オリックス・バファローズ→Hankyu Braves, Orix Blue Wave, Orix Buffaloes(）、西宮球場（阪急西宮スタジアム）Nishinomiya Kyujo (Hankyu Nishinomiya Studium）、プロ野球地域保護権→定訳不明：the right of pro baseball area protection.
sen.e: The old Hankyu Company, which later became Hankyu Holdings (current Hankyu Hanshin Holdings), was the parent company of a pro baseball team, the Hankyu Braves (later Orix Blue Wave and currently the Orix Buffaloes), and owned the Nishinomiya Kyujo (later Hankyu Nishinomiya Stadium which was closed in 2002) under the right of pro baseball area protection.

The old Hankyu Corporation, which later became Hankyu Holdings (currently Hankyu Hanshin Holdings), was the parent company of a pro baseball team, the Hankyu Braves (later Orix Blue Wave and currently the Orix Buffaloes) from 1936 to 1988, and owned the Nishinomiya Kyujo (later Hankyu Nishinomiya Stadium, which was closed in 2002) under the right of pro baseball area protection.

sen.e: In the Kanto District, the way of calling a private railway company, "XX-Densha ('company's name'- train)" is quite common, however, nowadays, "Hankyu Densha" is seldom used on advertisement displays.

sen.j: これは1992年の創業85周年を機に、会社側が公式な通称を「阪急電鉄」と変更したため。
sen.e: Because in 1992, the company changed its common official name to "Hankyu Dentetsu (Hankyu Railway)" when it celebrated the 85th anniversary of foundation.

sen.j: 一般的にホームの呼び方は「○番線」だが、阪急電鉄では「○号線」という呼び方である。
sen.e: Generally the name of platforms includes the number like "Platform No. X," however, in Hankyu Railway, "go" is attached to the number like "Platform X-go."

sen.j: これは「○番線」が社内での構内配線に対しての呼び方であるため。

sen.j: ホームが2本しかない駅では島式・対向式に関係なく原則として自動放送でホーム番号を言わず、「皆様、まもなく大阪梅田方面に向かう電車が到着します」のように、行き先の方面で表現する。
sen.e: As there are only two platforms, regardless of the type of platform, island type and opposing type, instead of an automated announcement of the platform number, basically the direction the car heading for is announced as follows: "Ladies and gentlemen, in a short time, the train for the direction of Osaka Umeda Station will arrive."

sen.j: 2006年10月1日からは神戸線・宝塚線で2007年3月16日からは京都線の駅ホームでの案内放送を「ただいま到着の電車は各駅停車梅田行きでございます」から「ただいま到着の電車は各駅停車大阪梅田行きです」に変更している。
sen.e: At the stations on the Kobe Line and Takarazuka Line, the announcement has been changed since October, 2006, from: "The train now arriving is a local train bound for Umeda," to "The train now arriving is a local train bound for Osaka Umeda," and on the platforms of the stations on the Kyoto Line since March 16, 2007.

At the stations on the Kobe and Takarazuka lines, the announcement has been changed since October, 2006, from: "The train now arriving is a local train bound for Umeda" to "The train now arriving is a local train bound for Osaka Umeda," and on the platforms of the stations of the Kyoto Line since March 16, 2007.

At the stations on the Kobe and Takarazuka lines, the announcement has been changed since October 1, 2006, from: 'The train now arriving is a local train bound for Umeda' to 'The train now arriving is a local train bound for Osaka Umeda,' and on the platforms of the stations of the Kyoto Line since March 16, 2007.
sen.cmt: 括弧修正October 1 としました。

sen.j: 梅田・三宮・新開地・河原町の4駅については「大阪梅田」「神戸三宮」「神戸新開地」「京都河原町」のようにアナウンスする（繰り返す場合は2回目以降、大阪・神戸・京都の部分を省略する）。
sen.e: Regarding the 4 stations, Umeda, Sannomiya, Shinkaichi, and Kawaramachi, the name is announced as "Osaka Umeda," "Kobe Sannomiya," "Kobe Shinkaichi," and "Kyoto Kawaramachi" (when the name is repeated twice or more, Osaka, Kobe or Kyoto is omitted).

Regarding the four stations Umeda, Sannomiya, Shinkaichi and Kawaramachi, the names are announced as "Osaka Umeda," "Kobe Sannomiya," "Kobe Shinkaichi" and "Kyoto Kawaramachi" (so that when the name is repeated twice or more, Osaka, Kobe or Kyoto is omitted).

Regarding the four stations of Umeda, Sannomiya, Shinkaichi and Kawaramachi, the names are announced as 'Osaka Umeda,' 'Kobe Sannomiya,' 'Kobe Shinkaichi' and 'Kyoto Kawaramachi' (so that when the name is repeated twice or more, Osaka, Kobe or Kyoto is omitted).

sen.j: ただし「神戸新開地」の呼称は大阪府内（梅田駅や十三駅など）のみ実施し、兵庫県内では単に「新開地」とアナウンスされる。
sen.e: "Kobe Shinkaichi" is the way of calling employed only inside Osaka Prefecture (Umeda Station, Juso Station, etc.) and at the stations located in Hyogo Prefecture, the name is simply announced as "Shinkaichi."

"Kobe Shinkaichi" is the way of calling employed only inside Osaka Prefecture (Umeda Station, Juso Station, etc.), while at the stations located in Hyogo Prefecture the name is simply announced as "Shinkaichi."
The name 'Kobe Shinkaichi' is used only inside Osaka Prefecture (Umeda Station, Juso Station, etc.), however; at the stations located in Hyogo Prefecture, just 'Shinkaichi' is announced.

sen.j: また、神戸高速線内の上り列車では「阪急三宮」「阪急・大阪梅田」とアナウンスされる。
sen.e: In the up trains running on Kobe Rapid Transit Railway lines, the names of the destinations are announced as "Hankyu Sannomiya," and "Hankyu/Osaka Umeda."
In the up trains running on Kobe Rapid Transit Railway lines, the names of the destinations are announced as "Hankyu Sannomiya" and "Hankyu/Osaka Umeda."
In the inbound trains running on Kobe Rapid Transit Railway lines, the names of the destinations are announced as 'Hankyu Sannomiya' and 'Hankyu Osaka Umeda.'

sen.j: 乗客は着席にこだわる者が多く、梅田駅では発車間際の特急や急行のドアの前に着席目当てで次の電車を待つ乗客の列がいつもできている。
sen.e: There are many passengers who obsessively stick to a determined seat, and therefore, at Umeda Station you can always see many passengers, who although are staying in rows in front of the doors of a limited express or an express train that is just to depart, are actually waiting for the next train with the expectation of sitting on their favorite seat.

There are many passengers who obsessively stick to a determined seat, and therefore at Umeda Station one can always see many passengers, who although they are staying in rows in front of the doors of a limited express or an express train that is just to depart, are actually waiting for the next train with the expectation of sitting in their favorite seat.

There are many passengers who insist on being seated, and therefore at Umeda Station one can always see many passengers, who although they are staying in rows in front of the doors of a limited express or an express train that is soon to depart, are in fact waiting for the next train with the expectation of sitting.
sen.cmt: めあての座席に座りたいわけではなく、単に座りたい、という訳にしました。"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 川西能勢口駅や宝塚駅のように他線との乗換駅では次の電車の着席目当てで乗客が猛然とダッシュする風景も見られる。
sen.e: At some transfer stations to other lines like Kawanishi-Noseguchi Station and Takarazuka Station, you can see many passengers making a furious dash for the next train to secure his/her seat.

At some transfer stations to other lines like Kawanishi-Noseguchi Station and Takarazuka Station, one can see many passengers making a furious dash for the next train in order to secure that favorite seat.
At some transfer stations to other lines like Kawanishi-Noseguchi Station and Takarazuka Station, one can see many passengers dashing furiously for the next train in order to secure seats.

sen.j: なお、十三～梅田間の折り返し乗車は通常では不正乗車（この区間は運賃計算に含まないため）であるが、なにわ淀川花火大会（旧・平成淀川花火大会）の際には十三駅が大変混雑するため、梅田までの折り返し乗車を特例で認めている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, on ordinary days, riding on a turned back train between Juso Station and Umeda Station is considered illegal (as the return-trip of the section is not calculated in the fare), but the day in which the Naniwa Yodogawa Fireworks Display (formerly called Heisei Yodogawa Fireworks Display) is celebrated, round-trip to Umeda Station is exceptionally admitted because Juso Station becomes enormously crowded.
sen.cmt: なにわ淀川花火大会（旧・平成淀川花火大会）→定訳不明：Naniwa Yodogawa Fireworks Display (formerly called Heisei Yodogawa Fireworks Display)としました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, on ordinary days it's considered illegal to ride on a turned-back train between Juso Station and Umeda Station (since the return-trip of the section is not calculated in the fare); however, the day on which the Naniwa Yodogawa Fireworks Display (formerly called Heisei Yodogawa Fireworks Display) is celebrated, the round trip to Umeda Station is exceptionally admitted because Juso Station becomes enormously crowded.

Meanwhile, on ordinary days it's considered illegal to ride on a turned-back train between Juso Station and Umeda Station (since the return-trip of the section is not calculated in the fare); however, the day on which the Naniwa Yodogawa Fireworks Display (formerly called Heisei Yodogawa Fireworks Display) is celebrated, the round trip to Umeda Station is exceptionally admitted because Juso Station becomes enormously crowded.

tit.j: 携帯電話電源オフ車両
tit.e: Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car
tit.cmt: 携帯電話電源オフ車両→定訳不明： "Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car"としました。
tit.e: Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car
Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car

sen.j: 阪急電鉄では、携帯電話の電源オフを終日ルールづけた車両「優先席携帯電話電源オフ車両」を全列車に設定している。
sen.e: Hankyu Railway sets in all the trains a car named "Priority Seat / Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car," in which mobil phones are ruled to be switched off all day.
Hankyu Railway places in each train a car called the "Priority Seat / Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car," in which mobile phones must be switched off at all times.
Hankyu Railway places in each train a car called the 'Priority Seat / Mobile Phone Power Source Off Car,' in which mobile phones must remain off at all times.

sen.j: 2003年6月10日から1か月間限定で試験導入、同年7月11日から本格的に導入した。
sen.e: This car was provisionally introduced during one month from June 10, 2003 on trial basis and since July 11 of the same year, it has been formally introduced.
This car was provisionally introduced on a trial basis during a one-month period beginning June 10, 2003, but since July 11 of the same year it has been formally operated.
This car was provisionally introduced on a trial basis during a one-month period beginning June 10, 2003, but since July 11 of the same year it has been formally operated.

sen.j: また京都線に直通する大阪市営地下鉄堺筋線や同じ阪急グループの能勢電鉄・神戸電鉄でも導入されている。
sen.e: The car is also introduced in Osaka City Subway Sakaisuji Line, which is connected directly with the Kyoto Line, and Nose Electric Railway and Kobe Electric Railway, both of which are members of Hankyu Group.

The car is also introduced in the Osaka City Subway Sakaisuji Line, which connects directly with the Kyoto Line as well as the Nose and Kobe electric railways, both of which are members of the Hankyu Group.

The car is also introduced in the Osaka Municipal Subway Sakaisuji Line, which connects directly with the Kyoto Line as well as the Nose and Kobe electric railways, both of which are members of the Hankyu Group.

sen.j: またこの「携帯電話電源オフ車両」についてのアナウンスは、車掌によって少し違うことがある。
sen.e: The way of announcing on the "Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car," sometimes varies according to the conductors.
The way of announcing on the "Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car" varies occasionally, according to the conductor.
The manner in which the 'Mobile Phone Power Source Off Car' is announced varies occasionally, according to the conductor.

sen.j: 設定車両：1車両（神戸・宝塚・京都・嵐山・伊丹・箕面・川西能勢口側の先頭車両）
sen.e: The designated car: 1 car (the first car of the trains heading for Kobe, Takarazuka, Kyoto, Arashiyama, Itami, Minoo, Kawanishi Noseguchi).
The designated car is car "1," (the first car of a train heading for Kobe, Takarazuka, Kyoto, Arashiyama, Itami, Minoo, Kawanishi Noseguchi).
The designated car is car 1, (the first car of a train heading for Kobe, Takarazuka, Kyoto, Arashiyama, Itami, Mino, Kawanishi-Noseguchi).

tit.cmt: The reserved priority seats for elderly or disabled persons was abolished in all cars on all lines (All seats of all cars were designated as priority seat.)

sen.j: もう一つ、阪急電鉄の独自ルールとして特筆されたものが「全席優先座席」である。
sen.e: As another unique rule of Hankyu Railway worth mentioning was the designation of "all seats-priority seats "
As another unique rule of Hankyu Railway worth mentioning was the designation of "all seats--priority seats."
Another unique rule of Hankyu Railway worth mentioning was the designation of 'all seats--priority seats.'

sen.j: 阪急電鉄では「特定の席にこだわらず、すべての座席で譲り合いの精神を」とのことから、決まった優先座席を廃止して1999年4月から「全席優先座席」を導入していた。
sen.e: In Hankyu Railway, "Priority seats" were abolished and "All seats-priority seats" had been introduced since April 1999, based on the idea that "we must show a spirit of give-and-take at all seats no matter whether it is designated or not."
sen.cmt: 譲り合いの精神→a spirit of give-and-take (英辞郎on the WEB)、全席優先座席→定訳不明：”All seats-priority seats"としました。
sen.e: In Hankyu Railway, "Priority seats" were abolished and "All seats--priority seats" was introduced in April 1999, based on the idea that "we must show a spirit of give-and-take at each seat, whether it is designated or not."

In Hankyu Railway, 'Priority seats' were abolished and 'All seats--priority seats' was introduced in April 1999, based on the idea that 'we must show a spirit of give-and-take at each seat, whether it is designated or not.'

sen.j: 阪急電鉄で「携帯電話電源オフ車両」が設定されたのは、同業他社が「優先座席付近では携帯電話の電源をオフ」というルールをこぞって導入したが、阪急には特定の優先座席がなかったためこうなった。
sen.e: Related to this rule, Hankyu Railway had to set up "Mobil Phone Power Source Off "cars, because it didn't have any designated priority seats in the cars, while all other companies introduced the rule to switch off the mobil phone only around the reserved seats.
sen.cmt: 携帯電話電源オフ車両→定訳不明： "Mobil Phone Power Source Off Car"としました。 where the passengers are requested to untaggle his mobil phone, were experimentally introduced in all trains (for the details, please refer to the special comment)
sen.e: Coincident with this rule, Hankyu Railway had to set up "Mobil Phone Power Source Off " cars because it didn't have any designated priority seats in the cars, but all other companies introduced the rule to switch off the mobil phone only around the reserved seats.

Coincident with this rule, Hankyu Railway had to set up 'Mobile Phone Power Source Off Cars' because it didn't have any designated priority seats in the cars, but all other companies introduced the rule that mobile phones should remain off only around the reserved seats.

sen.j: ところが、阪急電鉄側の思惑とは裏腹にこの「全席優先座席」は浸透せず、ほとんど座席の譲り合いが行われていないという現状を受け、2007年6月末の阪急阪神ホールディングスの株主総会で再設置の要望があったのを機に全席優先座席を見直すことになり、同年10月29日に「全席優先座席」は廃止され、再び「優先座席」を設置した。
sen.e: However, against the company's expectation, it was revealed that the "All seats-priority seats" rule had not been penetrated among the passengers and the give-and-take spirit of the seats was seldom practiced, therefore the company decided to review the "All seats-priority seats" rule, based on the request for bringing back the priority seat which was presented at the shareholders meeting at the end of June, 2007, and on October 29 of the same year, the "All seats-priority seats" rule was abolished and the reserved "priority seats" were designated.

However, against the company's expectation it was revealed that the "all seats--priority seats" rule had not been penetrated among the passengers and the give-and-take spirit of the seats was seldom practiced; therefore, the company decided to review the "all seats--priority seats" rule, based on the request to brink back the priority seating, as presented at the shareholders meeting at the end of June 2007; and on October 29 of the same year the "all seats--priority seats" rule was abolished and the reserved "priority seats" were designated.

However, against the company's expectation it was revealed that the 'all seats--priority seats' rule had not been accepted among the passengers and the give-and-take spirit of the seats was seldom practiced; therefore, the company decided to review the 'all seats--priority seats' rule, based on the request to bring back the priority seating, as presented at the shareholders' meeting of the Hankyu Hanshin Holdings at the end of June 2007; and on October 29 of the same year the 'all seats--priority seats' rule was abolished and the reserved 'priority seats' were designated.
sen.cmt: 括弧修正 brink →bring阪急阪神ホールディングスを追加しました。

sen.j: しかし、優先座席の設置箇所は基本的に各車両の「梅田を前方としたときの最後尾座席」であるのだが、運転台、もしくは運転台跡が存在する車両はそれらの逆側の座席となっており、中間に運転台およびその廃止改造を行った車両が含まれる編成（神戸線の8032Fなど）だと、優先座席が車両によって前の方にあったり後ろの方にあったりとあまり統一されていないという懸念がある。
sen.e: Although, the "priority seats" were basically set at "the seats that shall be the final in the car when heading toward Umeda Station," it is not well-unified among the cars, because, in the cars with the driver's platform or the vacant space remained after the platform was removed, the priority seats are set just on the opposite of it, and when the fleets include such a car in the middle (like 8032F on the Kobe Line), the priority seats' position becomes sometimes in the anterior part and other times in the posterior part.

However, the "priority seats" were basically set as "the seats that shall be the final in the car when heading toward Umeda Station," it is not well unified among the cars because, in the cars with the driver's platform or the vacant space remaining after the platform was removed, the priority seats are set just on the opposite of it, and when the fleet includes such a car in the middle (like 8032F of the Kobe Line), the priority seat position is sometimes in the anterior part but other times in the posterior part.

However, there still is a concern that, although the 'priority seats' are basically set as 'the seats that shall be the most posterior part of the car when heading toward Umeda Station,' it is not well unified among the cars because, in the cars with the driver's platform or the vacant space remaining after the platform was removed, the priority seats are set just on the opposite side of it, and when the fleet includes such a car in the middle (like 8032F of the Kobe Line), the priority seat position is sometimes in the anterior part or other times in the posterior part.
sen.cmt: 文脈を考えて一部修正しました。括弧修正final →most posterior part

sen.j: 駅構内で優等列車の通過待ちをする列車の乗務員は必ずホームに立ち通過監視を行う。
sen.e: The crew of a local train waiting for a higher category train to pass at a station, is obliged to stand on the platform to monitor the passing train.
The crew of a local train waiting for a higher-category train to pass at a station is obliged to stand on the platform and monitor the passing train.
The crew of a local train waiting for a higher-category train to pass at a station is obliged to stand on the platform and monitor the passing train.

sen.j: そのとき運転士はブレーキハンドルを非常ブレーキ位置にセットし、さらにマスコンキー（京都線車両の5300系以前についてはリバースハンドル：主幹制御器に取り付ける前進・後進の切り替えハンドル）を所持してホームに立つ。
sen.e: Then, the driver, in addition to setting the brake handle at the emergency position, stands on the platform taking the master controller key with him (when the train is Kyoto Line Train Series 5300 or older, the reverse handle: a switching handle bar for going forward/backward, which is attachable to the principle controller).

sen.j: 1990年代後半頃に近畿地方の鉄道事業者では初めて外部の事業者のテレビ番組、映画、ドラマの撮影を認めた（日本の鉄道事業者で最初にこの事業を開始したのは京成電鉄である）。
sen.e: In the late 1990s, as the first railway company in the Kinki District, Hankyu Railway allowed third-party entities to shoot TV programs, movies and dramas in its premises (in Japan, Keisei Electric Railway was the first railway company that started TV and movie shooting business).
